Of what we are sure is that rates of crime ami delinquency are

cent of the A&P grocery stores threatened and robbed by the preda¬
ceous gunmane There are streets and areas in Detroit where over
eighty percent of the young men have been arrested by police at one
time or another* City after city* and now the towns and villages*
show an inexorable Increase in crime day by day* year by year*
What then is modern man to do about this ancient problem? How
may he best bring about order and security in his cities? When
shall his women and children walk about their avenues and parks in
equal assurance* be it night or day?
There are many voices across the land and from out of time*
each with a prescription* Some are brutish* adamant* and harsh*
There are others who prefer an unrealistic passivity and misplaced
tenderness* There are the dry* quiet utterances that seldom find
their way past the ivy covered walls* These proffered solutions
are important and must be given heed* for out of this seeming chaos
we get our phllosphy and day to day treatment of the criminal offender*
Sometimes the voices are strident* Every folk tavern has its
expert on these matters* Every man* who lives in a democracy* has
the right to pronounce his theory* only some do it more vocally than
others* It is in this* then* that there is h0peOoo.«that most men
